column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r184184183\r\r1\r203183183\r\r2\r193203173\r\r3\r20212032112\r\r4\r282242222\r\r5\r9831273253\r\rOther**\r\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement353\r\rThree district-wide staff development days have been provided each year for the past five years. Three additional staff development were added to the\r2016-17 school calendar for a total of six days.  In 2018-19 teachers were given the option for two additional voluntary PD days.  All K-5 Teachers have\rCommon Planning Time on Mondays with two minimum days scheduled for professional development during the year.  Middle school teachers work in\ra block schedule that provides weekly collaboration time on Wednesday mornings. Teachers at each grade level TK-5 participate in Long Range Planning\r(LRP) Days which focus on using student achievement data to help develop and hone effective instructional strategies and programs.\r\rTeachers have also used LRP time for observing colleagues and utilizing our Literacy
column4: and Technology Teacher Coaches. Teachers also receive\rongoing support and mentoring throughout the year from the Literacy
column5: Math and Technology Coach on special assignment. For 2017-18
column6: the team of\rcoaches helped teachers to focus on improving their instructional practice
column7: developing the opportunities for S.T.E.A.M. based learning
column8: and differentiating\rgrowth opportunities for all teachers. Staff developers from Columbia University Teachers College continue to advance teachers’ skills in Readers and\rWriters Workshop. Outside consultants continue to also provide guidance and support with the implementation of mathematics. Orinda teachers directly\rparticipate in the Bay-Sci program
column9: a partnership with U.C. Berkeley and Lawrence Hall of Science
column10: which helps develop our NGSS-based Science teaching\rand learning.\r\rSummer training has been offered in the District where teachers receive more specialized training in reading
column15: and technology. Teacher discussion groups and Book Clubs exist at school sites that provide teachers the opportunity to collaboratively share\rprofessional materials of mutual interest. New teachers participate in the Teachers Induction Program through the Contra Costa County Office of\rEducation and includes literacy
column16: math and technology classes.\r\rThe District Technology Coaches model lessons in classrooms
column17: provide classes/ workshops to teachers based upon surveyed needs and interests and\rsupport principals in their efforts to enhance curriculum and instruction through advancing the use of technology and our signature practices in classroom\rinstruction.  ... Unnamed: 6
